definition: to advance by leaps and bounds
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
to fly
ferocious/fierce/violent/brave/suddenly/abrupt/(slang) awesome
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: With your wonderful leadership skills, your career is guided by drive, stamina and commitment.
sentences.chinese: 伴随着你杰出的领导能力，工作突飞猛进地发展。

sentences.english: The wheel of technology history turns remarkably fast.
sentences.chinese: 科技发展的历史突飞猛进。

sentences.english: Nowdays, science and technology are growing in leaps and bounds, and knowledge economy has shaped it's small form.
sentences.chinese: 当今世界，科学技术突飞猛进，知识经济已见端倪。

sentences.english: The development of two years of advance rapidly, created new start for phlogistic yellow network.
sentences.chinese: 两年突飞猛进的发展，为炎黄网络创造了新的起点。

sentences.english: Trade within the region has been growing by leaps and bounds.
P2P networking applications have seen explosive growth in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 对等网应用在近几年内已得到突飞猛进的发展。

sentences.english: While after renaissance time, modern surgery in western medicine has been largely improved by its technologies.
sentences.chinese: “文艺复兴”以后的西医外科学得到突飞猛进地发展。

sentences.english: With spending in check, the economy soared during his term.
sentences.chinese: 通过控制开支，美国经济在他执政期间一路突飞猛进。

sentences.english: Their business has grown by leaps and bounds.
Global trade increased enormously in the second half of the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪后半叶，全球化贸易突飞猛进。

sentences.english: Technolgical developments in the field of genetic engineering have proceeded rapidly in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 最近以来遗传工程学技术突飞猛进。

sentences.english: Construction of postal and telecommunications facilities greatly expanded.
sentences.chinese: 邮电通信建设突飞猛进。

sentences.english: Over the past two decades, China has achieved exceptionally rapid economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 年中，中国经济突飞猛进地增长。

sentences.english: But not so radical that you think it's science fiction.
sentences.chinese: 但不会突飞猛进到你以为是科幻那样的程度。

sentences.english: Shani started out slow but dug deep on his final lap.
sentences.chinese: 沙尼起步很慢，但在最后一圈中突飞猛进。

sentences.english: We are now witnessing a period of rapid transformation in the global marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 当前，我们正目睹一个全球市场突飞猛进的时期。

definition: lit. one day, a thousand miles (idiom); rapid progress
qualitative leap
remarkable (progress, improvement, expansion etc)
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
rapid progress
progress/improvement/to improve/to progress/CL:個|个[ge4]
to make a breakthrough
to overtake
to forge ahead vigorously/to dedicate oneself to progress
lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
breakthrough/going beyond/leap-forward/unusual new development
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
bottleneck
to leap to (a higher position etc)/to jump/(of a plane) to ascend
to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
